body.p: The IASB also considered the proposed definition of an asset in the May 2015 Exposure Draft The Conceptual Framework for Financial Reporting (the ‘Conceptual Framework Exposure Draft’). That exposure draft proposes to define an asset as ‘a present economic resource controlled by the entity as a result of past events’ and defines an economic resource as ‘a right that has the potential to produce economic benefits’. In the IASB’s view, a lessee’s right to use an underlying asset would meet this proposed definition of an asset, for the reasons described in paragraph BC22.
